1121112221222221332.content:
It's the holidays. Snow blankets the yard and rooftop of your parents' home where you grew up. The fireplace is kindling, the family photographs are stacked on the coffee table in the living room, and the table is set for a holiday meal.

Emma met your family several times before, so she had no anxiety when she and Jess arrived home from college earlier that morning. You complimented Emma on her dress, giddily chatting her up about the latest goings-on at her sorority and her job serving tables at a nightclub near campus. You're still amazed that Emma can find the time to work, maintain a social life, and study for an Engineering degree. Jess strode through the doorway in a plaid, long-sleeved sweater and jeans, discarding her boots beside the doorway.

"Have you been working out?" You wink, causing Jess's face to flush in embarrassment.

"And you look as beautiful as ever," She replies, nodding as she inspects your outfit. You're wearing the same sleeveless dress you wore to the gala last weekend, in addition to a pair of hose and several bangles on your wrists and arms. The dress hugs your svelte figure while allowing its built-in cups to accentuate your bust. You spent two hours that morning primping and preening in front of the mirror, curling your wavy brunette hair to perfection. That was, of course, after your daily visit to the gym. You worked extra hard on the elliptical, feeling your muscles burn in anticipation of the holiday meal later that day.

"I didn't realise everyone is dressing up so nicely," Jess murmurs, tearing her eyes off her girlfriend and towards you.

"Oh, this old thing?" You twirl around, laughing. Loving every chance to display your sexy, tight body, even in front of its former owner. "I want to look nice for when we take some family pictures. It may be the last time we get together for a long time."

"Are Natalie and Robert coming?" Jess asks, referring to your older siblings, aged 31 and 33 respectively.

"Sadly, no." You explain. "Nat is meeting Joey's family this year, and Robert said he couldn't make it." Natalie graduated from college with a business degree several years ago and works for a large corporation in the city. She met her current boyfriend at a volunteering event and they've been inseparable ever since. Robert and his high-school sweetheart, Samantha, got married and already have four children. You met their kids a few months ago and couldn't believe it when they called you 'Auntie Steven'. You're an aunt now.

"Dad's watching the football game in the other room. Why don't you say hello?" You point with a manicured nail. Jess holds Emma's hand as they greet your parents, sitting down on the couch together as they talk to Dad. His beer belly is as big as you remember, though his hair is as white as the snow outside now. You rejoin your Mom in the kitchen as you two prepare the holiday meal.

You love how womanly cooking makes you feel. This year you opt to do most of the meal preparation, which Mom appreciates since her bones had become a bit weaker and the doctors advised her not to exert herself too much. You never have the chance to cook for a large group of people, since you only live with your roommate Sarah. You're both models, and vegetarians, and you almost never drink alcohol because of how the extra calories go straight to your hips and thighs.

But today is different because it's the holidays and you're with family. You feel a little tipsy and that's after only two glasses of wine!

"Mom, can you move those plates out of the way for me?" You ask, bending down to open the oven door and pull out a roasted ham. Setting it on the kitchen counter, you measure the temperature and take off your oven mitts. Holding the stem of the wine glass, you take another sip and sigh. "Mmm, is it hot in here or is it just me?"

Your Mom mixes some mashed potatoes. "I think you've had enough to drink, young lady. At this rate, you won't even be awake for supper!" She takes the glass out of your hand and sets it down on the table.

"I forgot how fun it is to cook for others!" You beam, smoothing out your dress.

"Just look at Jess and Emma. Between you and me..." Mom asks, sidling up close to you. "Have you ever thought about settling down with someone?"

You brush her off playfully. "Not this question again! What's the matter, mother? You already have a crop of grandchildren." Chopping some tomatoes into a salad, you add, "It's not that I don't mind settling down. You know how much I love modeling. I still have plenty of time to find the right guy...or girl..."

Your Mom places her hands on your shoulders. "That's true, honey. I remember feeling the same way when I was your age. Do you know how I met your father?"

You roll your eyes, tuning out yet another speech from your mother, one you've heard countless times before. When she pauses, you chuckle, "Are you sure you haven't had too much to drink?"

Your Mom scoffs, "It's always in one ear and out the other with you, Steven. Tell you what... why don't you tell Emma and the boys that supper's ready?"

You untie your apron and fold it on the counter before mincing out to the living room. Emma and Jess are holding hands, with Jess drinking a can of beer in the other hand while spreading her legs apart. They're talking about the game, name-dropping several players who you don't recognise.

"Excuse me, supper's almost ready! Wash your hands and get up to the table!" You announce. "Been slaving over a hot stove for you boys all day, now get your butts out here pronto!"

Jess and Dad grumble and ask for a few more minutes to catch the next play in the game, while Emma shrugs helplessly at you. You roll your eyes again and spin around, hips swishing smartly in your dress as you walk away.

But they do make their way to the table, and you begin serving each of them. You're on your third glass of wine by this point, and although you know your limits you've pushed beyond them and feel quite warm and toasted.

Jess and Emma do most of the talking. Still attending college, their lives are the most interesting. Mom and Dad speak up whenever they can, particularly to humiliate Jess with some story from her childhood. But one area which none of you mention involves Jess's life before the head swap. Several years ago you all promised never to discuss it outside of the family. So the embarrassing stories primarily centre around Jess going through puberty as a teenage boy.

Eventually, Jess and Emma look each other in the eyes. "Mom... Dad... Steven... we have an important announcement to make." Jess says happily, again clasping hands with Emma. "We wanted to save it until today to tell you... but..."

Jess takes a ring out of her pocket and slips it over Emma's finger. "We're getting married!"

Your baby sister getting married? You feel like you want to cry. Tears well up in your eyes as you brush them away, not wanting them to ruin your makeup. Mom is right there with you, doing a better job keeping it together (as she's probably not as drunk as you are at the moment). Dad cracks a big smile and slaps Jess's back proudly. They explain their wedding and honeymoon plans, as the ceremony won't happen for a few more months and they still have a lot of planning to do.

You congratulate the happy couple, getting up from the table to hug Jess and Emma. Feeling your body enveloped in Jess's strong arms, having to look up at her towering, 6'3'' frame. You never would have reacted this way in your old body, but your emotions are all over the place upon hearing the news.

Supper ends soon after that, and the family slowly migrates over to the living room to look over old family photos. You dismiss Mom so she can reminisce with them, while you clear away the settings and wrap up the leftovers.

It takes a while to clear the food away, clean off the dishes, and find enough room in the refrigerator to put away everything. As you're thinking of different ways to prepare the leftovers, Jess appears in the kitchen.

She has an uncertain look on her face. Rubbing the back of her neck, she clears her throat.

"Hey, um, Steven... do you mind if we speak for a moment? Y'know... alone?"

You turn around and smooth out your dress. "Of course, Jess. Is something wrong?"

She beckons you to throw on a cardigan and overcoat, as she slips into her own boots for a walk outside. You've had these one-on-one talks with her before, usually when one of you had something heavy weighing upon your mind. You almost protest, since you're wearing little more than a light-fitting dress and it's cold outside. But you can tell Jess really wants to talk about something.

The question is: What does she so badly want to talk about?

The sky looms gray and cloudy overhead, which matches Jess' melancholy mood as you walk alongside her in your parents' neighbourhood after supper. Her hands are in her pockets, kicking a stone along the sidewalk which had been freshly shoveled from snow earlier that morning.

You zip up the overcoat, tie up your long hair in a ponytail with a scrunchie, and throw the hoodie over your head to stay warm. But your hairless legs are cold within the skimpy evening dress, and you can feel your nipples hardening and pressing against your bra. You're still a bit drunk but you learned how to hold your alcohol and stay poised. It's cold outside which also helps to sober you up a little.

You shiver. "Well, Jess, come out with it. What's up?"

These private conversations with your little sister (though she's much bigger than you now, physically speaking) don't happen much anymore, since you've settled into your new lives. But you were there for each other... when Jess struggled with romantic feelings for other girls or when you got your first period.

She shrugs her broad shoulders. "I thought I'd feel better after proposing to Emma, but something's missing. Like... there's this weight still on my chest I gotta get rid of."

The penny drops. "You don't mean...?" You gasp.

She nods. "Yeah-huh. I think she deserves to know about us. About the head swap. D'you know that happened almost ten years ago?"

"Why does she need to know?" You protest. "Long ago, we made a promise never to tell anyone outside of the family what happened, what we agreed to..."

"I know that," Jess replies tersely. "But when Emma and I get married, she'll become part of this family too."

"So you think she deserves to know... before committing to spending her life with you?" You surmise.

"Don't you think that's reasonable, Steven? Wouldn't you want to know something like that about whoever you plan to marry?"

You frown. "I suppose so, Jess. But what's the point after all this time?"

"What do you mean?"

Your face flushes, and not just because of your drunkenness. You find yourself rambling, "I mean that the person Emma is going to marry is you. That body you've had now for the past ten years? It's yours, Jess. And this body is mine. I've gotten used to it. And I know you've spent more of your conscious life as a boy than as a girl. Hell, you went through puberty as a guy! You have guy friends. Emma doesn't need to know what you used to be, since that part of you is long gone."

Jess clicks her tongue. "I still think it's wrong not to tell her. What if she somehow finds out? Then it will look really bad if I didn't tell her."

"How's she gonna find out? Mom and Dad are just as tight-lipped about this as I am." You reply. "So are Natalie and Robert."

"I know..." Jess sulks. You don't talk for a few minutes, rounding a corner and turning back toward the house. You can see your breath it's so cold outside.

She breaks off a small tree branch overhanging the street and snaps it into pieces as she walks. "How about you tell her about your head-swapping powers at least?"

"I haven't tried them ever since we swapped." You tell her. But that's a lie; a few years ago at a party you and your girlfriends were drunk, so you decided to try swapping each other's heads around for fun. Thankfully it ended there, with everyone believing they were so thoroughly sloshed they must have only imagined being head swapped. But that was when you realised you'd always have these powers to use... or abuse.

Of course, you resisted urges to use the powers, as they always seemed to cause more trouble than they're worth. Every time you envied the figure of another man (or woman) at the gym or the beach, you imagined performing a harmless little 'upgrade.' But a part of you still viewed the body below your head as belonging to your sister.

"Then maybe your powers still work?" Suggests Jess. "You can demonstrate them to Emma by swapping with her. It doesn't have to be long term, you know, just a quick switcharoo to see how she takes it. If she's open-minded about this sort of thing, then we can test the waters about coming clean with her."

Her idea seems reasonable enough... or maybe that's the booze talking. But you feel uninhibited at the moment and open to the idea of swapping with Emma. Picturing your sister's fiance's toned ass and perky tits beneath her clothing is enough to get your heart racing. You feel your own nethers twitch in excitement, never having lost your teenage male lust for pretty women.

You exhale. "Okay Jess, I can't believe I'm saying this. But you have a deal." Jess hops up and down in glee, for a moment looking out of place as a big man on the sidewalk. "Only this one time, and only long enough to see how she reacts. Okay?"

"Okay!" She chirps.

You two shake hands on it and re-enter your parents' house, having left for about fifteen minutes in total. Everyone was sitting where they were before, watching the game on the TV.

The question is: How do you choose to swap heads with Jess' fiance Emma?

1452212.content:
After pressing the button on the collar, a feeling like vertigo washes over you as your mind struggles to make sense of your surroundings. It takes several moments before you regain enough of your senses to take in the surroundings. Instead of standing, you are suddenly lying down on something soft. Light was pouring in from something beside you, a window. You look to your left, seeing a parking lot outside. "Where..." You recognized one of the many parkings lots for the town's local mall. You slowly tilt your head to look forward. You recognize the inside of a car, your brother's truck. Country music from a radio station was softly playing in the background.

Someone's breathing from beside you catches your attention. You turn and see your brother sleeping directly beside you and very close. However, you did not care about the distance between you at the moment. "How did I end up in his truck?" you ask out loud, putting the pieces together of where you were. "What button did I push?"

You lean back against the headrest and your right ear lightly touches your brother's ear. "What is going on?" You scratch the top of your nose, in the space between your eyes. You abruptly stop and stare at your hand, realizing two things at once. You were missing your glasses, and the hand that you used to relieve an itch was not yours. Your missing glasses were a minor problem, considering you seemed to have good vision all of a sudden. What really concerned you was the stranger's hand. It was your brother's left hand. "What the hell?" You quickly looked to your right, staring at your sleeping brother's too close head. Look past, you noticed that the middle and passenger seats were empty. You and Robert were both in the driver's seat. You lifted your head all the way from the head rest and saw the reason why. Both of you heads were joined to the same body, his body.

You gawked. An invisible line seemed to split his body in half. You only had sensation, control of the side your head rested on. It felt as if you had been cut in half even though you could clearly see one body. "Shit!" you swore. You wiped sweat that had formed above your eyebrows. "What did that thing do?" You closed your eyes and tried to think. "Calm down. I need the collar. Which must still have been at home, in my room." You slowly turned to look at Robert. You were not sure if your should try to wake him or not. You carefully felt along the side of the driver's seat. Finding the handle controlling the seat, you slowly ease into an upright position.

Staring forward, you notice the mirror inside the sun visor. You reach and adjust the mirror to see your reflection. "Is that me?" You adjusted the mirror multiple times to make sure you were not seeing things. "I look just like Robert!" The mirror clearly showed a face nearly identical to your brother's. You had the same goatee, the same eyes, and the same dimples. Your hair was dyed the same color, but you had it cut longer. You gripped the steering wheel with your only hand to steady yourself. "What the hell did this thing do? I need to drive home?" The image of an accident popped into your head. Driving would not be a good idea in your condition. "Shit!" You closed your eyes and banged your head against the seat rest. Unintentionally, Robert began to wake. He opened his mouth and yawned loudly.

14522121.content:
You were not sure what to do as Robert stirred beside you. Watching in silence, he lifted his hand above his head. You felt your mutual back try to arc as your brother stretched, his side of the body. He wiped the sleep from his eyes, seemingly obvious to the situation. However, it did not take him long to sense someone was staring at him. He slowly turned his head. His face morphed into shock when he saw you. "Wah!" a startled cry left his lips. He jumped to the side, or at least tried to. His body barely lifted out of the driver's seat. You watched as Robert's gaze shifted to his body, your shared body.

You quickly slapped your hand over his mouth before he could scream. "Don't scream Robert." You tried to say as calmly as possible, even though you, yourself, were confused about the situation. "Its me, Steven... sorta of..." You opened your mouth to say more, but you were at a loss of words.

Robert yanked your hand away from his mouth. "Steven? Y-You look like me!" Robert stuttered. His gaze then shifted back to your body. "Why dod you look like me?! Why... How are you on my body! What the hell is going on?!"

"Uh..." You dry swallowed. You were conflicted about whether to tell him the whole truth or not. Given the situation, you decided that the truth would be the best option. As you and he only had control of half of his body each, you would need Robert's help to find the collar. Besides, you rationalized that you were never really good at lying; your brother had a good ability of knowing when you were less than truthful. You explained what you knew, which was still very little. You retold about the strange message you received in your dream this morning but chose to ignore it, and how after a mid-day nap you woke up with a strange collar around your neck. "My head was then gone after pressing a button. It was frightening. I was blind and deaf... I could only feel with my hands. I pushed another button hoping that my head would come back, but... now we're...."

You watched as Robert closed his eyes, as if he was processing all the information. After a few moment, he opened his eyes and stared at you, "So you're saying that you have... some magic collar that... did whatever this... is?!"

"Look, I don't know how it did... this. But, we have to get back home. The collar will still be in my room." You emphasized going home. "I'm sure it can fix whatever it did to us." At least, you hoped it could. You chose not to share that little bit.

Robert took a deep breathe. It was a strange sensation, feeling your chest rise when someone else took a deep breathe. "I can't believe this is happening... Okay, we go home." Robert grabbed the keys and turn the ignition.

"What are you doing?" You asked, surprised by him turning the car on.

"Going home." He stated simply.

"We can't drive!"

"How else are we going to get home!"

"Walk. The mall is not that far from the house."

"Oh, yeah... walk. I'm sure no one will notice some two-headed dude waltzing down the sidewalk."

"And no one would notice some two-headed guy trying to drive down the street? We're walking."

"No, we're driving!" Robert stated. He went to place the car into gear, but you reached across and shut off the ignition. "What the fuck, Steven!" He tried to turn it back on, but you wrestled his hand to keep it away. Your body rolled back and forth. Your legs flew around, kicking wildly. A snap and the resulting thump of something falling made you both stop fighting. The two of you stared at each other for a second before looking down to see what was broken. The keys for the ignition had snapped clean off. "Steven! You broke my keys!"

"Well, I guess that means we're walking now." You said, trying to hide your smirk.

Robert growled, clearly not happy. "Fuck you." he finally said. You and he had to lean forward so he could pick up the broken car keys from the floor.

You then felt for the door handle and lifted it so the door would swing open. You and Robert next attempted the task of maneuvering your body out of his truck. It was far harder than you would have thought; you had underestimated just how difficult cooperating your two halves was. Robert grabbed the handhold along the side of the interior, and you tried to lower your foot to the ground. Your foot was not quite planted on the ground when Robert tried bring his leg around. The two of you lost balance and landed on the hard asphalt.

Your hand stung, but you ignored the pain. You and Robert slowly brought yourselves back onto your feet, using the truck for support. "Brilliant idea Steven! Walking is such a better way of getting home."

"Shut up!" You glared at your brother, though you were having second thoughts about walking all the way back home. It suddenly seemed like a very long distance even though it was just a mile. "You still have your cell phone, right? We could call Mom to come pick us up."

Robert rolled his eyes, "And explain this how? 'Hi Mom, can you come pick Steven and I from the mall. We can't drive home because Steven used some magic collar to turn us into some two-headed freak!'"

"You forget about how I look like your twin now too." You said in your best condescending tone. That earned you a glare from your brother, but he did not say anything else. "Then we walk home. Stop complaining."
